Package com.concordia.soen6441riskgame

Class RGGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.concordia.soen6441riskgame.RGGame
  • public class RGGame
extends java.util.Observable
    Class to store and control the information of a game. Only one game is possible during runtime
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Julian Beltran, Amit, Abhishek, Aamrean

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean allOutMode
      Created to know if "All Out mode" is set on or off
      private java.lang.String attackStatus
      Created to store the status of the Attack Phase for a given player.
      private boolean cardGiven
      Created to know if a card was given to a player to avoid giving another card during the same turn for the same player.
      private RGGraph cardItems
      Created to store the set of cards players use in Reinforcement Phase
      private RGGraph continentItems
      Created to store the Continents' data structure.
      private RGGraph countryItems
      Created to store the Countries' data structure.
      private static RGGame game
      Created to store the current game (only one game is possible).
      private RGGraph graph
      Created to store the Graph's data structure.
      private java.lang.String phase
      Created to store the current phase that is being played.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) void assignCountries​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> players)
      This method is used to assign each country a random player, and one army by default to each country.
      (package private) void attackPhase​(java.lang.String selectedCountryAttacker, java.lang.String selectedCountryDefender, java.lang.String selectedDiceAttacker, java.lang.String selectedDiceDefender, java.lang.String currentPlayerName)
      This method is used to process the actions taken by a player during the Attack Phase:
      (package private) void attackPhaseModeDecision​(java.lang.String selectedCountryAttacker, java.lang.String selectedCountryDefender, java.lang.String selectedDiceAttacker, java.lang.String selectedDiceDefender, java.lang.String currentPlayerName)
      This method is used to play a battle according to the mode chosen by the player: 1) One battle mode.
      (package private) void attackPhaseNoAttackers​(java.lang.String currentPlayerName)
      This method is used to move to the next phase automatically due to there are no more available territories to attack.
      (package private) void attackPhaseNoMovements()
      This method is used to skip the Attack Phase due to the player does not want to attack.
      (package private) void capturedTerritoriesArmyDeployment​(java.lang.String selectedCountryAttacker, java.lang.String selectedCountryDefender, java.lang.String armyToDeploy, java.lang.String currentPlayerName)
      This method is used to deploy army to a new captured territory in Attack Phase.
      (package private) void capturedTerritoriesNoMovements()
      This method is used to skip deployment of army to a new captured territory in Attack Phase.
      (package private) void createContinents​(java.lang.StringBuilder content)
      This method is used to create one data structure: 1) Continents Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information associated to the continents of the map.
      (package private) void createGraph​(java.lang.StringBuilder content)
      This method is used to create two data structures: 1) Map Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information related to the countries and their adjacencies with other countries.
      (package private) void fortificationPhase​(java.lang.String countryFrom, java.lang.String countryTo, int armiesToMove)
      This method is used to process the actions taken by a player during the Fortification Phase:
      (package private) void fortificationPhaseNoMovements()
      This method is used to skip the Fortification Phase due to the player does not want to move any army.

      This method is used to know if All Out mode is set "on" or "off"

      This method is used to obtain the list of countries to where a given player can attack.
      (package private) RGGraph getCountryItems()
      This method is used to obtain countryItems' data structure where the current game is stored.

      For fortification phase: This method is used to obtain the territories to where a player can move army.

        Created to store the current phase that is being played.

      • attackStatus

        private java.lang.String attackStatus
        Created to store the status of the Attack Phase for a given player. Possible values: 1) empty: Nothing to do. 2) "end": End of the game. 3) "move": Used to show a frame to move army when a territory is captured.

        private boolean cardGiven
        Created to know if a card was given to a player to avoid giving another card during the same turn for the same player.

    • Method Detail

      • getGame

        static RGGame getGame()
        This method is used to assure only that one instance of the game (only one game) is created.
        Returns:
        Current game.

      • setPhase

        void setPhase​(java.lang.String phase)
        This method is used to set the current phase of the game.
        Parameters:
        phase - Current phase.

      • getPhase

        java.lang.String getPhase()
        This method returns the current phase of the game for a specific moment.
        Returns:
        Current phase of the game for a specific moment.

      • createGraph

        void createGraph​(java.lang.StringBuilder content)
        This method is used to create two data structures: 1) Map Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information related to the countries and their adjacencies with other countries. The key value is the name of a country (String), and the value of the key is an ArrayList (String) that contains all the adjacent countries. 2) Countries Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information associated to the current game. The key value is the name of a country (String), and the value of the key is an ArrayList (String) that contains all the information of the county: Coordinate X in the map, coordinate Y in the map, continent, owner, and number of armies placed in a specific country.
        Parameters:
        content - Complete content of the tag [Territories] of the file.

      • createContinents

        void createContinents​(java.lang.StringBuilder content)
        This method is used to create one data structure: 1) Continents Data Structure: This is a HashMap data structure that contains all the information associated to the continents of the map. The key value is the name of a continent (String), and the value of the key is an ArrayList (String) that contains all the information of the continent: continent bonus army, and all the countries that belong to that continent.
        Parameters:
        content - Complete content of the tag [Continents].

      • assignCountries

        void assignCountries​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> players)
        This method is used to assign each country a random player, and one army by default to each country.
        Parameters:
        players - List of Players (names).

      • getCurrentPlayerNumberOfCountries

        This method is used to obtain the number of countries a player owns.

        Returns:
        Number of countries a player owns.

      • getNumberOfArmiesDueTerritories

        int getNumberOfArmiesDueTerritories​(int currentPlayerNumberOfCountries)
        For Reinforcement Phase: This method is used to obtain the number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries. This number is calculated according to the number of countries a player owns.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerNumberOfCountries - Current number of countries a player owns.
        Returns:
        Number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries.

      • getNumberOfArmiesDueContinents

        int getNumberOfArmiesDueContinents​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> currentPlayerCountries)
        For Reinforcement Phase: This method is used to obtain the number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries. This number is calculated according to the number of continents a player owns.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerCountries - List of countries a player owns.
        Returns:
        Number of armies a player has the right to place on his/her countries.

      • getCurrentPlayerAdjacentCountries

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCurrentPlayerAdjacentCountries​(java.lang.String player,
                                                                        java.lang.String country)
        For fortification phase: This method is used to obtain the territories to where a player can move army.
        Parameters:
        player - Name of the player.
        country - Name of the country.
        Returns:
        A list of all the countries that have a path in between.

      • getPlayersName

        java.lang.String getPlayersName​(java.lang.String country)
        This method is used to obtain the owner of a country.
        Parameters:
        country - Name of the country.
        Returns:
        The owner of the country.

      • initializeGame

        void initializeGame()
        This method is used to set initial values for the current game: 1) Set the number of armies for a player in the Setup Phase 2) Allocate zero cards for every player. 3) Allocate zero armies for every player for Reinforcement Phase.

      • initializeSetOfCards

        void initializeSetOfCards()
        This method is used to create the set of cards in the cardItems' data structure. A random card type is assigned for every country in position 0. Types: 1) Infantry represented by number (0). 2) Cavalry: Represented by number (1). 3) Artillery: Represented by number (2). 4) Wild: Represented by number (3). In position 1, it will be stored the owner of the card.

      • setupPhase

        void setupPhase​(java.lang.String selectedCountry,
                java.lang.String currentPlayerName)
        This method is used to process the actions taken by a player during the Setup Phase:
        Parameters:
        selectedCountry - Selected country from list.
        currentPlayerName - Name of the player.

      • reinforcementPhase

        void reinforcementPhase​(java.lang.String selectedCountry,
                        java.lang.String currentPlayerName,
                        java.lang.String armiesToPlace)
        This method is used to process the actions taken by a player during the Reinforcement Phase:
        Parameters:
        selectedCountry - Selected country from list.
        currentPlayerName - Name of the player.
        armiesToPlace - Number of armies to place in a given country.

      • fortificationPhase

        void fortificationPhase​(java.lang.String countryFrom,
                        java.lang.String countryTo,
                        int armiesToMove)
        This method is used to process the actions taken by a player during the Fortification Phase:
        Parameters:
        countryFrom - Origin country.
        countryTo - Destination country.
        armiesToMove - Number of armies to move.

      • fortificationPhaseNoMovements

        void fortificationPhaseNoMovements()
        This method is used to skip the Fortification Phase due to the player does not want to move any army.

      • getDiceAttacker

        Parameters:

      • getDiceDefender

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getDiceDefender​(java.lang.String selectedCountry)
        This method is used to obtain a list with the number of dice a player can use to defend.
        Parameters:
        selectedCountry - Defending country.
        Returns:
        List with the number of dice a player can use to defend.

      • attackPhaseModeDecision

        void attackPhaseModeDecision​(java.lang.String selectedCountryAttacker,
                             java.lang.String selectedCountryDefender,
                             java.lang.String selectedDiceAttacker,
                             java.lang.String selectedDiceDefender,
                             java.lang.String currentPlayerName)
        This method is used to play a battle according to the mode chosen by the player: 1) One battle mode. 2) All out mode.
        Parameters:
        selectedCountryAttacker - Attacking country
        selectedCountryDefender - Attacked country.
        selectedDiceAttacker - Number of dice to attack.
        selectedDiceDefender - Number of dice to defend.
        currentPlayerName - Name of the player.

                 java.lang.String currentPlayerName)

        selectedCountryDefender - Attacked country.
        selectedDiceAttacker - Number of dice to attack.
        selectedDiceDefender - Number of dice to defend.

      • getAttackStatus

        java.lang.String getAttackStatus()
        This method is used to get the attack status. Possible values: 1) empty: Nothing to do. 2) "end": End of the game. 3) "move": Used to show a frame to move army when a territory is captured.
        Returns:
        Status.

        void setAttackStatus​(java.lang.String status)
        This method is used to set the attack status. Possible values: 1) empty: Nothing to do. 2) "end": End of the game. 3) "move": Used to show a frame to move army when a territory is captured.
        Parameters:
        status - Status.
